description: From Middle French philodoxe, from Ancient Greek φιλόδοξος (philódoxos, “opinion-loving”), compound of φίλο- (phílo-, “beloved”) + δόξα (dóxa, “glory; opinion”).

entries.meaning: A person with an excessive interest in his/her own opinions.
examples: This, however, is a difficult task that only a true philosopher, and not a mere philodox, will be willing to tackle.
